movies.title: Almanya
movies.plot: The story of three generations of a Turkish immigrant family.
movies.simplePlot: The story of three generations of a Turkish immigrant family.

biography.bio: Vedat Erincin was born in 1957. He is an actor, known for Almanya (2011), A Most Wanted Man (2014) and Une seconde femme (2012).
biography.name: Vedat Erincin

biography.bio: Fahri Yardim was born in Hamburg, Germany, the son of an academic family of Turkish extraction. Performing on stage in school productions he developed his love of acting. He trained at the Hamburger Bühnenstudio der darstellenden Künste (Hamburg Stage Studio of the Performing Arts) and appeared in theatre productions in Berlin and Hamburg. Fahri represents a generation that focuses on character rather than nationality. He is a naturalist who avoids ethnic stereotype, and his versatility is mirrored in his choice of roles: He portrayed an Anatolian in Almanya (2011), a Greek in Kebab Connection (2004), a German Sinte in Chiko (2008), a German in Mogadiscio, destination terreur (2008), and a woman in Unter Frauen (2012). His most memorable roles include the Brunswick-set film 66/67: Fairplay Is Over (2009). 2012 proved to be a peak year allowing him to demonstrate the range of his talent and his powerful, committed, discursive and nuanced personality. He played a priest in Marcus H. Rosenmüller's Wer's glaubt, wird selig (2012), an artist in Marc Rothemund's Mann tut was Mann kann (2012), a paramedic in Lars Becker's ZDF thriller Appelez le 112 (2012), a doctor in the ProSieben crime drama Kreutzer kommt ... ins Krankenhaus (2012) and a detective in the Sat.1 thriller drama Hannah Mangold & Lucy Palm (2011). In 2013 he will appear with Ben Kingsley in the international movie version of L'Oracle (2013). In Austria he is a regular in the ORF police drama CopStories. And in March of 2013 he was Til Schweiger's partner in the first of several projected Tatort (1970) episodes.
biography.name: Fahri Yardim

biography.bio: Lilay Huser was born in 1958. She is an actress, known for Almanya (2011), Chiko (2008) and What a Man (2011).
biography.name: Lilay Huser

biography.bio: Demet Gül was born in Stuttgart, Baden-Württemberg, Germany. She is an actress and writer, known for Almanya (2011), A Quintet (2014) and Einmal Hans mit scharfer Soße (2013).
biography.name: Demet Gül

biography.bio: Aykut Kayacik was born on December 4, 1962 in Akhisar, Manisa, Turkey. He is an actor and director, known for Almanya (2011), What to Do in Case of Fire (2001) and Zenne Dancer (2012).
biography.name: Aykut Kayacik

biography.bio: Aycan Vardar is an actor, known for Almanya (2011) and Monaco 110 (2014).
biography.name: Aycan Vardar

biography.bio: Ercan Karacayli was born on August 15, 1967 in Istanbul, Turkey. He is an actor, known for Almanya (2011), Brüder (2012) and Meine Beschneidung (2013).
biography.name: Ercan Karacayli

biography.bio: Kaan Aydogdu was born on May 14, 1999 in Berlin, Germany. He is an actor, known for Almanya (2011), Meine Beschneidung (2013) and Soccer Kids - Revolution (2010).
biography.name: Kaan Aydogdu

biography.bio: Siir Eloglu was born in 1965. She is an actress and writer, known for Almanya (2011), Einmal Hans mit scharfer Soße (2013) and Five Years (2013).
biography.name: Siir Eloglu

biography.bio: Aliya Artuc is an actress, known for Almanya (2011) and Kaddisch für einen Freund (2012).
biography.name: Aliya Artuc

biography.bio: Petra Schmidt-Schaller was born on August 28, 1980 in Magdeburg, German Democratic Republic. She is an actress, known for Unknown (2011), Stereo (2014) and Secret meurtrier (2011).
biography.name: Petra Schmidt-Schaller

biography.bio: Denis Moschitto was born on June 22, 1977 in Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. He is an actor, known for Chiko (2008), Kebab Connection (2004) and No Regrets (2001).
biography.name: Denis Moschitto

biography.bio: Aylin Tezel is a German actress known for Almanya - Welcome to Germany (Berlinale Competition 2011) and Breaking Horizons (2012) for which she received the Best Actress Award at the Torino Film Festival and the German Actors' Award for Best Upcoming Actress. On television she is known for her central performance as Cinderella in Aschenputtel (2011), directed by Uwe Janson, and for her series lead regular role as young cop Nora Dalay in Germany's most popular police drama Tatort. She played lead role Heidi in Marco Kreuzpaintner's film Coming In (2014) for Warner Bros and received the German Actors Award 2015 for Best Actress in a comedic role for her performance in Kleine Schiffe. Her following work included the lead role of Aylin in Christof Wahl's new feature film Macho Man (2015) and the lead role of Sabine in Robert Manson's forthcoming debut feature film Lost in the Living (2015). Most recently Aylin filmed 6 episodes for the Canadian CBC Spy Drama Series X Company as Jewish Polish Resistance Fighter Zosia. Her character first shows up in season 3 of the World War II drama series which will premiere in January 2017. Besides her acting studies at the Ernst Busch Academy of Dramatic Arts in Berlin Aylin Tezel studied dance and choreography in Germany's North Rhine-Westphalien city Bielefeld. She also directed the documentary Trust me it works (2011) about the British choreographer Royston Maldoom as well as the short film Tanz mit ihr (2013,Inhale), which premiered at the Cork Film Festival 2013, the Berlin and Beyond Film Festival in San Francisco (2014) and aired on German- French TV Channel ARTE in June 2015.
biography.name: Aylin Tezel

biography.bio: Trystan Pütter is an actor, known for Toni Erdmann (2016), Phoenix (2014) and War Horse (2011).
biography.name: Trystan Pütter

biography.bio: Rafael Koussouris was born in 2002 in Munich, Bavaria, Germany. He is an actor, known for Almanya (2011), Les Frères noirs (2013) and Ice Is Melting (2014).
biography.name: Rafael Koussouris

awards.award: Guild of German Art House Cinemas 2011
